  • Method Details

    • getJsonInput

      public static HashMap<String,String> getJsonInput(String jsonFilePath, String testCaseName)
      Useful in get input as per given testCaseName from json file.
      Parameters:
      jsonFilePath - The full path to the JSON data file.
      testCaseName - The value to search for (e.g., "TC_001_Login").
      Returns:
      A HashMap<String, String> containing the test case's input data. *

      Example Usage in a TestNG DataProvider (Single Test Case):

      This example demonstrates how to use this method to run a TestNG test method only once, using the data for a specific TCID.

      
 @DataProvider(name = "getJsonData")
 public Object[][] getJsonData()
 {
      HashMap<String, String> singleTestData =
      JsonReader.getJsonInput("path/to/data.json", "TC_001_Login");
      // Wrap the single HashMap into the required Object[][] format
      // [1 row] [1 column: the HashMap]
      Object[][] dataArray = new Object[1][1];
      // Place the HashMap into the single cell [0][0]
      dataArray[0][0] = singleTestData;
      // Return the array. TestNG will execute the @Test method once.
      return dataArray;
 }
      *

      The JSON file must contain an array of objects, similar to the following structure:

      
 [
      {
          "testCaseName": "TC_001_Login",
          "username": "adminUser",
          "password": "securePassword123"
      },
      {
          "testCaseName": "TC_002_Invalid_Password",
          "username": "adminUser",
          "password": "wrongPassword"
      }
 ]

    • getJsonInputs

      public static List<HashMap<String,String>> getJsonInputs(String jsonFilePath) throws IOException
      Reads all data from a JSON file (containing an array of objects) and maps it. This is typically used to execute the same test case with multiple different inputs.
      Parameters:
      jsonFilePath - The full path to the JSON data file.
      Returns:
      A List of HashMaps, where each HashMap represents one test case (data row).
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the file is not found, cannot be read, or the JSON is invalid. *

      Example Usage in a TestNG DataProvider:

      The DataProvider must wrap the returned List elements into an Object[] array.

      
 @DataProvider(name = "getData")
 public Object[] getData() {
      List<HashMap<String, String>> data = JsonReader.getJsonInputs("path/to/data.json");
      // To execute the test case 2 times (first two rows)
      return new Object[] {data.get(0), data.get(1)};
      * // To execute the test case 1 time (first row)
      // return new Object[] {data.get(0)};
 }
      *

      Expected JSON Structure:

      The JSON file must contain an array of objects, similar to the following structure:

      
 [
      {
          "username" : "Admin",
          "password" : "admin123"
      },
      {
          "username" :"Mayur1",
          "password" :"Mayur01@2025"
      }
 ]
      IOException
